intro: Geonoma paleacea, commonly known as the pale leaf fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant has distinctive, leathery, pale green leaves that are often clustered at the base. Its fronds are typically elongated and have a fibrous texture, which helps it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Geonoma paleacea is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to adapt to indoor growing conditions.
